title: the_rock_(movie)
body:
[b]The Rock[/b] is a 1996 action movie directed by Micheal Bay. 

The movie involves a group of rogue US Marines led by Brigadier General Frank Hummel, played by Ed Harris, who has taken over [[Alcatraz]] Island and demands the US Government compensate the families of his dead Marines who died in US black ops missions or he will launch missles armed with Nerve gas at the city of [[San Francisco]]. To stop them, [[FBI]] chemical weapons specialist, Dr. Stanley Goodspeed, played by [[Nicolas Cage]], and a former British Spy who has escaped Alcatraz in the past John Mason, played by [[Sean Connery]], join a Navy SEALs task force to infiltrate the island.

title: doctor_yumi
body:
Fictional character from the [[Mazinger Z]] series.

[b]Doctor Yumi Gennosuke[/b] is a very intelligent and experienced Japanese [[scientist]] heading the Photon Power Laboratory after the retirement of Dr. [[Kabuto Juuzou]]. 

Professor Yumi once worked under Doctor Kabuto and was inspired by his designs to create his own robot, [[aphrodai_a|Aphrodite A]]. Later Prof. Yumi and other scientists created the robot [[dianan_a|Diana A]]. 

Doctor Yumi is the father of [[Yumi Sayaka]].

title: george_joestar_ii
body:
Character in [i][[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]][/i], introduced during the [i][[Battle Tendency]][/i] arc.

The son of [[Jonathan Joestar]] and [[Erina Pendleton]] and father of [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]]. He was a famous fighter pilot during his service in World War I, and thus is typically depicted with his [[military uniform]] and [[garrison cap]] on.

He appears as one of the protagonists of the non-canon [i][[Jorge Joestar]][/i] novel. In this verse, he is born in Spain and subsequently named in Spanish style.

title: momo_(virgin_road)
body:
A female main character from the series [[shokei_shoujo_no_virgin_road|The Executioner and Her Way of Life]].  She is a young teen with [[pink hair]] worn up in [[twintails]] tied with [[hair ribbon]]s.

Momo is the assistant to the executioner [[Menou_(virgin_road)|]] and aids her in carrying out her duties.  Momo wears a modified priestess robe that features short frilly [[culottes]] with [[tights]]/[[pantyhose]] worn beneath it and white [[elbow gloves]] on her arms.  Her white priestess robe indicates her status as a novice and not yet fully recognized as a full priestess, while the yellow on it indicates that she belongs to no specific parish.  Her main weapon while fighting are enchanted coping saw blades.

Momo is two years younger than Menou and extremely capable.  She is infatuated with Menou, but unfortunately holds nothing but contempt for everyone else.  While Menou has to accompany [[Tokitou Akari|Akari]], Momo remains in the shadows carrying out duties for Menou.

title: tokitou_akari
body:
A female main character from the series [[shokei_shoujo_no_virgin_road|The Executioner and Her Way of Life]].  She is a Japanese first year high school student with [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] adorned with a white [[hairband]].  Her clothing consists of a school uniform composed of a sleeveless yellow double-breasted dress worn over a white long sleeve shirt with black cuffs adorned with a red neck ribbon, black skirt, white [[thighhighs]], and black shoes.

Akari is a "Lost One," a person isekai'd from Japan and who through the process ends up obtaining a reality breaking power attached to their soul called a "Pure Concept."   Akari's Pure Concept is "time" and her initial ability allows her to regress things to a previous state.  This ability can automatically trigger upon death and revert her body and mind back to a safe healthy state before what caused her death.

Upon meeting Menou, Akari feels that it was fate that they met and with only minor convincing by Menou ends up going along believing she will be taken somewhere safe by accompanying Menou.  Menou finds the extreme degree with which Akari trusts her to be abnormal.

title: stop_(gesture)
body:
A hand gesture in which one or both hands are fully open, with the arm(s) outstretched in front of the body, and the wrist(s) bent back at a 90 degree angle so that the fingers point upwards.

This gesture can be used to tell someone to literally stop moving forward and not come any closer to the person performing the gesture, or more figuratively to tell someone to stop doing some other action.

title: nanook_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A non-playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

They are an Aeon who represents Destruction. As the leader of the Antimatter Legion, they are highly considered to be the primary antagonist.

h4. Profile
[expand]
The birth of the universe is a mistake. If civilization is a growth of cancer birthed from vast stellar, then war is the only common language known to all intelligent lifeforms.

To correct the course and to rid the universe of the stain, Nanook must become the avatar of entropy.
[/expand]

title: ryouna_(senran_kagura)
body:
[[Senran Kagura]] character. A first year student at Hebijo. [[Ryoubi_(senran_kagura)|]]'s twin and elder sister.

If you're looking for someone to scold or do naughty thing to, she's your best candidate. Ryouna likes being chastised and scolded, loves showing off her [[breasts]] and is a giant [[masochism|masochist]] as seen during the course of the [[Senran Kagura Estival Versus]] installment. Pretty much any chance she gets after her sister lets it rip with expletives, aimed at her or others, she'll instantly get turned on leading to some glorious dialogue.

She has a freestyle shooting posture, has [[heterochromia|heterochromic]] eyes (one being [[green eyes|green]] and the other [[blue eyes|blue]] much like Ryoubi) and when transformed, dresses up as a princess complete with [[tiara]], [[angel wings]] and some bling. Her outfit shows off her curvy figure most of the time. Has over a dozen poses as she moves around on the field firing her guns.

Ryouna speaks in a somewhat annoying high pitched, squeaky voice, but this turns serious ranging from questioning to potentially violent if anyone mentions her deceased older sister or knows of her whereabouts.

h4. External links

* "Kagurapedia: Ryouna":[https://senrankagura.fandom.com/wiki/Ry%C5%8Dna]

title: minna_de_mamotte_knight:_hime_no_tokemeki_rhapsody
body:
[i][b]Minna de Mamotte Knight: Hime no Tokemeki Rhapsody[/b][/i] (Japanese title: [i]みんなでまもって騎士 姫のトキメキらぷそでぃ[/i]; English title: [i]Protect Me Knight with Everyone! The Princess' Heart-throbbing Rhapsody[/i]) is the sequel to the 2010 tower defense game, [i][[Mamotte Knight]][/i], developed by Ancient and was released in 2014 for the Nintendo 3DS eShop in Japan.

The game takes place after the events of the previous game, with Princess Lola safely rescued thanks to the efforts of the four heroes and peace restored to the kingdom; however, a new threat of evil monsters known as The Four Fiends led by an evil princess has risen to plunge the kingdom into chaos. [i]Minna de Mamotte Knight[/i] expands upon its predecessor's gameplay with the inclusion of two new classes, the Old Guy and the Archer, along with the four returning classes of the previous game, adds various new character customization and RPG elements, and features the ability to create your own custom maps with its own map editor and share them via QR codes, with a story that pokes light fun at various 80's Japanese pop-culture and retro video games. It also features an optional FM synth soundtrack as downloadable content. It was localized overseas under the name [i]Gotta Protectors[/i] in 2016.

In celebration of the game's 3rd anniversary in Japan, Ancient released a freeware mini-game in 2017, [i]Minna de Mamotte Knight: Amazon no Diet Daisakusen[/i] (also known as [i]Gotta Protectors: Amazon's Running Diet[/i] in English) that can be played on  Nintendo Entertainment System emulators. It is an endless runner-styled game that is based on a reoccurring gag of the Amazon and her chubby physique as she tries to run through a forest for long as possible while collecting glass of water to stay hydrated while avoiding cupcakes along the way. It can be downloaded from the game's official Japanese website in both English and Japanese. This game would be followed up with [i]Susume!! Mamotte Knight: Hime no Totsugeki Serenade[/i] (also known as [i]Gotta Protectors: Cart of Darkness[/i] in English) in 2019.

h4. External links
* "[i]Official game website[/i]":[http://www.ancient.co.jp/~game/mamotte_knight2/]
* "[i]Official Ancient developer website[/i]":[http://www.ancient.co.jp/]
* "[i]Wikipedia article[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protect_Me_Knight]

The [b]Ex-S Gundam[/b] is equipped with several new armor, weapons, and engine modules, increasing its overall performance. With these upgrades, the Ex-S Gundam has almost double the power of the original S Gundam, making it a fearsome unit indeed. 

The Ex-S Gundam is equipped with the Beam Smart Gun, INCOMs and the ALICE System, also known as [b]Advanced Logistic & In-consequence Cognizing Equipment[/b].

title: hula
body: A famous indigenous Hawaiian dance, in which participants attempt to portray an associated song or chant through their dance form. This is often seen accompanied by traditional decorations or clothing, such as [i]lei[/i] flower necklaces or grass skirts.

title: opaque_glasses
body:
[[Glasses]] that hide the character's eyes, usually because of light reflecting off the lenses.

This trope usually indicates a character is nerdy, and probably can't see without thick glasses, or is villainous and is trying to hide something sinister.

[b]Do not use[/b] this tag for [[sunglasses]] or glasses that are naturally opaque.

It consisted of a [[torn sweater|torn]] [[sleeveless sweater|sleeveless]]  [[white sweater|white]] [[turtleneck sweater]] with a [[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]], a [[harness]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]].

title: cafe_no_zombi-ko_(2nd_costume)
body:
The second version of [[Cafe no Zombi-ko]], after joining [[Project upd8]].

She was un-zombified, and her topwear was replaced with a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[black hoodie]] with the [[hood down]] and gave her [[heterochromia]] with [[red eyes]]. She also now has a [[bandaged neck]], [[bandaged hand]], and [[bandaged leg]] with a [[scar across eye|scar across her eye]].

title: radiohead_(band)
body:
An English rock band formed in 1985 in Abingdon, Oxfordshire. The band consists of Thom Yorke (lead vocals, [[guitar]], [[piano]]), Jonny Greenwood (lead guitar, [[keyboard_(instrument)|keyboard]], other instruments), Ed O'Brien (guitar, backing vocals), Colin Greenwood ([[bass guitar]]), and Philip Selway ([[drum_set|drums]], percussion). 

Radiohead's music is often characterized by its experimentation with alternative rock, art rock, electronic music, and avant-garde influences. The band is known for their complex and emotionally intense songs, often dealing with themes of alienation, technology, politics, and personal relationships. 

Radiohead has released nine studio albums to date, including critically acclaimed works such as "OK Computer" (1997), "Kid A" (2000), and "In Rainbows" (2007). They are considered one of the most innovative and influential bands of their generation.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Radiohead":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/radiohead]

title: running_in_the_90's
body:
An eurobeat song recorded by Maurizio De Jorio under the alias Max Coveri.

The song was popularized by [[Initial D]] where it is used in the first race between [[Takahashi Keisuke]] ([[mazda rx-7|FD3S]]) and [[Fujiwara Takumi]] ([[toyota sprinter trueno|AE86]]).

h1. Legacy
Due to the song's appearance in Initial D, it gained it's notoriety by using in situation where someone or something is traveling in high speeds, drifting or both.

title: shinguji_korekiyo's_sister
body:
[[Shinguji Korekiyo|Korekiyo]]'s beloved older sister.

[spoiler]A lonely girl who never had any friends, she was always prone to be hospitalized due to health problems and was only close to her brother. After her death, Korekiyo loses his mind and starts to murder any girl he considers kind enough to keep company to her spirit in the afterlife. He's obsessed with his sister to the point of having a split personality based on her, and claims they were in an incestuous relationship. 
She makes an apparition during Korekiyo's execution, only to turn against him with a smile.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Due to the Chapter 6 plot twist, it is heavily implied none of this is true, as it may have been only a fake backstory given to Shinguuji's character to make him more interesting in the show.[/spoiler]

title: lingzhi_(mushroom)
body: Ganoderma is a genus of polypore fungi in the family Ganodermataceae that includes about 80 species. Despite this recognition of additional species and subsequent discoveries of new Ganoderma species, the taxonomy of Ganoderma species has remained chaotic. The name "lingzhi" is commonly used to refer to both Ganoderma lucidum and Ganoderma sichuanense, though they're different species.

title: steyr_aug
body:
The [b]Steyr AUG[/b] ([i]Armee Universal Gewehr[/i], "Universal Army [[Rifle]]") is an Austrian 5.56×45mm NATO [[bullpup]] [b][[assault rifle]][/b] designed in 1977. The [[weapon]] features a very large trigger guard that covers the pistol grip, a tubular [[vertical foregrip]] and an integrated [[optical sight]] in most models. 

AUG HBAR is the light machine gun variant with a longer, heavier barrel and a bipod. 

h4. See also:
* [[AUG (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[Steyr AUG (Upotte!!)]]
* [[Steyr AUG Para]] [tn](Submachine gun variant)[/tn]

title: matcha_(food)
body:
Matcha is finely ground powder of specially grown and processed green tea leaves, traditionally consumed in East Asia. They are the center of [[tea ceremony]]. In modern times, matcha is used to flavor and dye foods. 

This tag refers to food and drink flavored by or covered in matcha powder, characterized by their green color. For matcha that has been turned into tea, see [[green tea]].

title: wonder_zone
body:
An outfit from [[Love Live! School Idol Project]]. It consists of a very simple and traditional English-style [[maid]] outfit with a relatively long dress, short sleeves, a black neck ribbon, and [[maid headdress]]. It appears in the anime in episode 9 of season 1 (which is also titled "Wonder Zone") and is used on the cover of the [[Korekara no Someday]] single (on which the song Wonder Zone is the B-side), but unlike other maid-themed but less traditional sets like [[Mogyutto "LOVE" de Sekkin Chuu!]] or [[Cafe Maid (love Live!)|]] it is notably not used on any [[Love Live! School Idol Festival]] cards. It's strongly associated with [[Minami Kotori]], due to the anime episode being about her and her secret maid cafe waitress career.

title: final_fantasy_ii
body:
Second JRPG developed by Square Co., Ltd. (later [[Square Enix]]) for the [[Final Fantasy]] series. It was first released on the Famicom (NES) system on 17 December 1988. It was later ported on the WonderSwan Color (2001), PlayStation (2002) [its first-ever English release], Game Boy Advance (2004), mobile phones (2005), PlayStation Portable (2007), and Apple products (2010).

The game follows the exploits of the Wild Rose Rebellion, specifically those of the orphan [[Firion]] and his friends, as they free the world from the clutches of the Palamecian Empire and its tyrannical leader, [[Emperor (ff2)|Emperor Mateus Palamecia]].

Not to be confused with [i][[Final Fantasy IV|FFIV]][/i], which was initially released in the USA as the "second" game in the series.

h4. Primary Characters

* [[Firion]] (Frioniel)
* [[Maria (ff2)|]]
* [[Guy (ff2)|]]
* [[Leon (ff2)|]] (Leon)
* The [[Emperor (ff2)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Final Fantasy II":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Final_Fantasy_II
* "Final Fantasy Wiki: Final Fantasy II":http://finalfantasy.wikia.com/wiki/Final_Fantasy_II

title: kefir
body:
Kefir is a fermented [[milk]] drink that originated with shepherds of the North Caucasus region, who discovered that fresh milk carried in leather pouches would occasionally ferment into an effervescent beverage. It is prepared by inoculating cow, goat, or sheep's milk with kefir grains.

Often tagged with images on pixiv as a cheeky euphemism for [[cum]].

A well-known [[meme]], "No, it's kefir" originated in TV commercials for "[i]Sennen Kefir[/i]" of Yazuya Co., Ltd.

* "ヨーグルト。いいえ、ケフィアです。" (Yoghurt. [i]Iie[/i], Kefir [i]desu[/i].)
** Youtube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zo4aASedPvk 

h4.See also

* Wikipedia article: "Kefir":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kefir]

title: final_fantasy_x
body:
The tenth [[Final Fantasy]] game, released for the Sony [[PlayStation 2]] in 2001.

The game's story revolves around a group of adventurers and their quest to defeat a rampaging monster known as Sin. The player character is [[Tidus]], a star athlete in the fictional sport of [[blitzball]], who finds himself in the world Spira after his home city of Zanarkand is destroyed by Sin. Shortly after arriving to Spira, Tidus joins the summoner [[Yuna_(ff10)|Yuna]] on her pilgrimage to destroy Sin.

title: dragon_ball_gt
body:
The third [[Dragon Ball]] anime series originally created as a direct sequel to [[Dragon Ball Z]]. Unlike the other series, the story is completely original and mostly lacks involvement from [[Toriyama Akira]] besides some character designs and concept art. [[Super Saiyan 4]] would be introduced in this series. 

Due to the anime's relative unpopularity in Japan, it aired for only two years between 1996-97 before being cancelled. GT would be considered non-canon with Dragon Ball's revival in 2013 and the later airing of [[Dragon Ball Super]]. Elements introduced by GT would later be picked up by the Dragon Ball video games, notably [[Dragon Ball Heroes]], keeping exposure to the series well after its cancellation.

h4. External link
* "Wikipedia: Dragon Ball GT":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dragon_Ball_GT

While he was one of the first three characters revealed  along with [[K1-b0]] and [[Harukawa Maki]], he is not the true protagonist.

He has [[spiked_hair|spiked]] [[purple hair]] as well as [[facial hair]]. He wears a purple jacket [[jacket_on_shoulders|on his shoulders]] that has [[space print]] lining. Also owns a [[kiseru]].

In reality, his true identity is the [[Ultimate Imposter]], and he has no real name. His true appearance is revealed in Chapter 5 and in the anime  [i][[Danganronpa 3 (anime)|]][/i], which simply narrows his eyes and gives him long [[black hair]] that has been [[hair slicked back|slicked back]]. He fills in for [[Mitarai Ryota]] in Hope's Peak while he is busy finishing his anime project.[/spoiler]

title: lavalier_microphone
body: A lavalier microphone or lavalier (also known as a lav, lapel mic, clip mic, body mic, collar mic, neck mic or personal mic) is a small [[microphone]] used for television, theater, and public speaking applications to allow hands-free operation. They are most commonly provided with small clips for attaching to collars, ties, or other clothing. The cord may be hidden by clothes and either run to a radio frequency transmitter kept in a pocket or clipped to a belt, or routed directly to the mixer or a recording device.

title: m1903_springfield
body:
The [b]Springfield M1903[/b] ([code]United States Rifle, Caliber .30-06, Model 1903[/code]) is an [[united states|American]] [[bolt action]] [b][[rifle]][/b] built on the Mauser action, fed with an internal 5-[[ammunition|round]] [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]. It was designed in 1903 and mainly manufactured by Springfield Armory.

It was used by US [[military|forces]], most notably during the [[world war i|Two]] [[world war ii|World Wars]], [[Korean War]], and [[Vietnam War]] for limited [[sniper rifle|sniper]] role. The [[weapon]] is recognizable by its straight grip stock, Type C semi-pistol grip stock (M1903A1 variant), bent bolt handle, oblong stock indentation on some models, and an adjustable flip-up rear sight or aperture one (M1903A3).

h4. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[Springfield (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: M1903 Springfield":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M1903_Springfield

title: garo_sho
body: GARO SHO form is a permanent upgraded form with the help of Priestess Ryūme. While helping Ryūga Dōgai cleanse the armor of Jaki (dark energies), Ryūme magically altered and enhanced Garo. However, to what end is unclear as Garo never exhibited any special abilities after its new form. The only thing visibly different from the armor is an improved look and thicker armor. Its forearm blade is now gone, this prevents Garo from making slash attacks upon targets, but the forearm is thicker, with a reinforced end near the elbow, giving Garo harder physical back strikes and blocking. The overall new coverage makes Garo less susceptible to damage and fatigue for its user. No special gimmicks have been revealed yet.

title: arjuna_alter_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. An Alter version of [[Arjuna (Fate)|]].

He has [[silver hair|silver]] or [[black hair]], [[grey eyes|grey]] or [[brown eyes]], [[dark skin]], [[horns]], [[wings]] and a [[tail]]. Wears [[pants]] and [[boots]] across all Ascensions.

[spoiler]Arjuna Alter is the result of the entire Hindu Pantheon (sans Kama/Mara) conglomerating in the body of the hero Arjuna. Appears as one of the main villains of Lostbelt nr. 4: Yugakshetra. Arjuna Alter is the king of the Indian Lostbelt; having been manipulated by [[Ashiya Douman (Fate)|Ashiya Douman]], he has been accelerating the Saṃsāra of Genesis and Terminus to the point of time-space growing unstable, all for the sake of a perfect world without evil.

When he finally fights his rival and half-brother [[Karna (fate)|]] in the climactic showdown, Arjuna Alter loses his usual cool and becomes dead-set on exterminating Karna once and for all.[/spoiler]

title: venusaur
body:

A large, stout, dinosaur-like creature with a bloomed flower on its back.

Evolves from [[Ivysaur]] (from [[Bulbasaur]]).

With Venusaurite it can [[mega pokemon|mega evolve]] into [[Mega Venusaur]], and it gains a new defensive ability and altered stats.
It can also [[Gigantamax]] into [[Gigantamax Venusaur]].

title: automag
body:
The .44 Auto Mag pistol (AMP) is a semi-automatic [b][[handgun]][/b] designed between 1966 and 1971 by the Auto Mag Corporation, chambered in propietary .44 AMP [[ammunition|cartridge]]. The [[weapon]] features a bolt housed inside the upper receiver, ventilated rib on its exposed barrel, and a [[M1911]]-style trigger. 

It is [[Harry Callahan]]'s alternate weapon in his fourth movie of the [[Dirty Harry]] series, Sudden Impact.

h1. See also
* [[AMT AutoMag]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: s&w_m10
body:
The [b]S&W Model 10[/b] is a six-shot K-frame [b][[revolver]][/b] produced by [[Smith & Wesson]] since 1899, chamber in .38 Special [[ammunition|cartridge]]. It saw wide use in various [[war|armed conflicts]] including [[World War II]] and by many [[police]] departments. The [[weapon]] is visually distinguishable by its exposed ejector rod and a rounded fixed front sight blade.

It was the [[handgun|sidearm]] of British and Commonwealth forces during the [[World War II]], alongside [[webley revolver|Webley Mk IV]] and the same-calibre [[s&w m10|Smith & Wesson Model 10]].

title: nagant_m1895
body:
A seven-shot [b][[revolver]][/b] introduced in 1895, designed and produced by [[belgium|Belgian]] industrialist Léon [b]Nagant[/b] for the [[Russian Empire]], chambered for propietary 7.62×38mmR [[ammunition]]. It has a unique gas seal system that allows the [[revolver]] to be properly [[suppressor|suppressed]]. 
Reloading is notoriously slow because [[shell casing]]s should be manually removed with its ejector rod before inserting new [[cartridge]]s one by one. The cylinder cannot be opened. 

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[Nagant Revolver (Girls' Frontline)]] 
* [[Tokarev TT-33]]

H1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Nagant M1895":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nagant_M1895

title: tokarev_tt-33
body:
A semi-automatic 7.62×25mm [b][[handgun]][/b] of [[Soviet]] origin, developed in 1930 by Fedor Tokarev for the Soviet [[military]] to replace the [[Nagant M1895]]. Initially designated as the TT-30, then slightly revised as the [b]TT-33[/b]. It saw service during the [[World War II]].
The [[weapon]] uses short recoil operation with tilting barrel, akin to the [[M1911]]. Visually recognizable by its wide slide serrations, circular external hammer, and [[star (symbol)|star]] symbol on the standard grip panels. 

This tag can also apply to any similar Tokarev pistol variants such as the [[china|Chinese]] Type 54.

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[Makarov PM]]
* [[Tokarev (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: TT pistol":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TT_pistol

title: fare_gate
body:
Lock fare gates, also called a baffle gate or a swing gate, are types of gates that allow one person through at a time to enforce one-way traffic of people. Some gates require paid access in order to pass through. They may have integrated [[ticket machine]]s to give one their ticket, or use optical interfaces where one can check in with a chipped card.

Types of fare gates include [[turnstile]] (tagged on Danbooru only when depicted as rotating "tripod":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Train_ticket_bariiers_in_Cairo_metro.JPG turnstiles), drop arm, full panel, flap barrier, bi-parting, swinging, retracting/sliding, etc.

title: exsedol_folmo
body:
[b]Exsedol Folmo[/b] (エキセドル・フォルモ, Eh-ki-se-do-ru Fo-ru-uh-mo?) is a character from the [[Macross]] universe. He first appeared in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] and then in [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]], [[Macross Flashback 2012]], [[Macross 7]], the movie Macross 7: The Galaxy Is Calling Me! and the OVA Macross 7 Encore.

Folmo is an [[alien]] [[Zentradi]] records keeping officer (a walking living encyclopedia) attached to fleet commander [[Vrlitwhai Kridanik]], and would always be seen at the side of his superior during Space War I giving advice.

He is a [i]Zem[/i] First Class "Archivist" Official in the Britai Fleet and his memory capacity is said to surpass any electronic device that ever existed, as he keeps details of every combat in the entire 500,000 year old Zentradi history for instant recall.

The name of the character was changed to [b]Exsedol 4970[/b] in the [i]Do You Remember Love?[/i] anime film and to [b][[Exedore]][/b] in the [[ROBOTECH]] American adaptation.

Compared to [[Lenneth Valkyrie]] and [[Hrist Valkyrie]], Silmeria has blonde hair and brown feathers on her helmet.

title: joe_musashi
body:
Main protagonist of the [[shinobi_(game)|SHINOBI]] series of action [[video game]]s by [[SEGA]]. 

He appears in the [[shinobi_(arcade)|Shinobi]] arcade game from 1987 as well as its sequels [[The Super Shinobi]], [[Shadow Dancer]], [[The Super Shinobi II]] and [[Shin Shinobi Den]].

[b]Joe Musashi[/b] is a veteran expert [[ninja]] master. Despite his vast knowledge of the ninja arts, he is quite pragmatic and unorthodox in his approach to combat.

He fights by throwing (an almost) infinite number of [[shuriken]]s or [[kunai]]s, and employs firearms for long range attacks, while using [[martial arts]] moves and [[katana]]s for melee combat.

Joe also uses different types of powerful ninja [[magic]] as well as a deadly white ninja dog called [[shadow_(shadow_dancer)|Shadow]].

title: pp-2000
body:
The [B]PP-2000[/B] (ПП-2000) is a Russian [b][[submachine gun]][/b] designed by the KBP Instrument Design Bureau in 2000. It utilizes blowback operation, and chambered for 9×19mm [[ammunition|cartridge]] (including the [[body armor|armor]]-piercing pressurized variants). The [[weapon]] features a [[handgun]]-like configuration, side-[[folding stock]], exposed bolt positioned over the barrel and an oversized pistol grip that doubles as a [[vertical foregrip]]. The [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] can also be used as a buttstock.

title: silence_suzuka_(racehorse)
body:
Real Life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]] (his effective namesake; "Suzuka" being a [i]kanmei[/i]) and foaled by Wakia, he was famed for his extreme front-runner running style. He had a poor Classics race year before becoming brilliant the next year, gaining his sole G1 win (The 1998 Takarazuka Kinen, against [[Air Groove (racehorse)|]] and poor [[Stay Gold (racehorse)|]]). His career and life ended abruptly at the 1998 Autumn Tenno Sho after a fracture of the left front leg, he was euthanized afterwards.

Silence Suzuka was a chestnut horse with a blaze marking and a sock on the right hind leg. He usually wore a green hood and had his mane braided, decorated with a green and yellow pompom.

He is the model for [i][[Umamusume]][/i]'s [[Silence Suzuka (umamusume)|]].

body:
The [b]PP-90[/b] is an open-bolt, 9×18mm Makarov folding [b][[submachine gun]][/b] designed by KBP Instrument Design Bureau in 1990s. It takes a rectangular shape in folded form. The only fire mode is fully automatic.

title: h&k_vp70
body:
The [b]VP70[/b] is very first polymer-framed semi-automatic [b][[handgun]][/b], manufactured by [[Heckler & Koch]] from 19[b]70[/b] to 1989. There are three main models, one of which is the VP70M (for [[military]] purpose) that can fire 3-round bursts when fitted with a [[shoulder stock]]. The VP70 has low-profile sights, a thin, sharply curved [[M1911]]-like trigger, contoured underside and trigger guard, small ejection port on the upper right of the slide, and a concealed hammer. It uses 9×19mm or 9×21mm IMI [[ammunition]].

h4. See also
* [[Beretta 93R]]
* [[H&K VP9]]
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[VP70 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Heckler & Koch VP70":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heckler_%26_Koch_VP70

title: orsis_t-5000
body:
The [b]ORSIS T-5000[/b] is a Russian [[bolt action]] [b][[sniper rifle]][/b] first developed by "ORSIS":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ORSIS in 2011. It features a 660 mm or 698 mm-long fluted barrel, Picatinny rails, skeletonized [[folding stock]] with adjustable cheek pad, a foldable [[bipod]] and uses standard 5-round [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]. The [[weapon]] is available in various chamberings, such as .338 Lapua Magnum and 7.62×51mm NATO.

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[SV-98]]
* [[T-5000 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "ORSIS website (English version)":https://orsis.com/en/production/product/202/
* "Wikipedia: ORSIS T-5000":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orsis_T-5000

title: bipod
body:
A two-legged stand attached toward the front of a [[gun|firearm]] (usually [[machine gun]] or [[sniper rifle]]). It supports the [[weapon]] on the [[on ground|ground]] (or some elevated structure) and reduces fatigue when the shooter must remain in a stationary position. Commonly collapsible/foldable to save space when not in use.

h4. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[tripod]]

title: pss_silent_pistol
body:
The PSS silent pistol or MSS "Vul" ("Вул") is a [[Soviet]] [b][[handgun]][/b] that fires specially-designed subsonic 7.62×41 mm SP-4 [[ammunition|cartridge]]. It was first issued to the [[KGB]] [[Spetsnaz]] in 1983. The [[weapon]] is compact just like the [[Makarov PM]], and has a notably wide grip profile.
The original PSS was succeeded by the PSS-2 in 2011, using the more powerful 7.62×43 mm SP-16.

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[PB pistol]]
* [[SPP-1]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: PSS silent pistol":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PSS_silent_pistol

title: pb_pistol
body:
The PB (ПБ, Пистолет Бесшумный "Silent Pistol") is a [[Soviet]]-designed integrally-suppressed [b][[handgun]][/b] introduced in 1967, based on the earlier 9×18mm [[Makarov PM]]. The [[weapon]] features a quick-detachable additional [[suppressor]], a shorter slide, grip shell that covers the upper frame without rounded shape and a straighter trigger guard profile.

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[PSS silent pistol]]
* [[SPP-1]]

h1. External links
* "Kalashnikov Group website":https://en.kalashnikovgroup.ru/catalog/boevoe-strelkovoe-oruzhie/pistolety/pistolet-besshumnyy-pb
* "Wikipedia: PB (pistol)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PB_(pistol)

title: data_matrix
body:
Data Matrix is a type of 2D barcode, similar to QR codes. The code consists of black modules arranged in a square pattern on white background. Compare to QR code, the most prominent characteristic is two straight edge on the left and bottom side of the code when positioned upright. Usually used in products nowadays.

h4. See also

[[mahoutsukai_no_yakusoku|Mahoyaku]] character.

Figaro (フィガロ) is a wizard that resides within the Southern Country. He is the Southern country doctor. He is a very knowledgeable and gentle person, who is brilliant in many ways with an approachable atmosphere. Good at socializing and is acquainted with lots of wizards, regardless of their country.

Rutile Flores (ルチル・フローレス) is a wizard that resides within the Southern Country. He is [[Mitile Flores]]'s older brother and a school teacher. He has a gentle personality. He lost his parents when he was young and lived with his younger brother while others around them helped. He believes in a future where humans and wizards can live together in harmony.

body:
[[mahoutsukai_no_yakusoku|Mahoyaku]] character.

Lennox Ram (レノックス・ラム) is a wizard that resides within the Southern Country. A silent shepherd youth. At first glance, he seems unapproachable and hard to talk to, but he’s very sincere when you get to know him. He holds a lot of trust with [[Figaro Garcia]] and the other Southern wizards. He believes it’s better to fight with his bare hands than to use magic.

title: ryuzaki_kaoru
body:
An [i][[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Passion (Yellow Sun) category. voiced by Haruse Natsumi. She holds her time with Producer (who she calls Sensei) very closely to her, Kaoru is very innocent and is well protected from danger by older idols. With the age of 9 years old, she is one of three youngest Idols in the Cinderella Cast, along with [[Ichihara Nina]] and [[Yokoyama Chika]]. She is voiced by [[Haruse Natsumi]].

h4. Profile
[table]
[tbody]
[tr]

title: ak-12
body:
A Russian 5.45×39mm [b][[assault rifle]][/b], designed in 2011 and manufactured by the Kalashnikov Concern. It is the fifth generation of [[Kalashnikov rifle]]s. The AK-12 was intended to supplant the [[AK-74M]] in the [[Russia]]n [[military|Armed Forces]]. The [[weapon]] features an adjustable [[folding stock]], three-round burst mode, a standard pistol grip with finger grooves, Picatinny rails, and a diopter rear sight instead of open one. 

The AK-19 is a variant chambered for 5.56×45mm NATO.

title: moe_(phrase)
body:
[b]Moe[/b] (萌え, /mo.e/, pronounced "mo-eh" literally "budding", as with a plant) is a Japanese slang word originally referring to fetish or love for characters in video games or anime and manga. For example, meganekko-moe (眼鏡っ娘萌え), or "glasses-girl moe" describes a person who is attracted to characters with glasses. "Moe!" is also used within anime fandom as an interjection referring to a character the speaker considers to be a 'moekko' (moe girl).

The term is subjective and would be a nightmare to untangle if left unrestricted.

[b]You should only use this tag when the image revolves around/mentions the concept of moe or has 'moe' written somewhere on it, not when the image evokes a feeling of moe itself.[/b]

h4. Related:

* [[so moe i'm gonna die!]]
* [[ultimate moe]]

title: fm_24/29
body:
The [i]Fusil-mitrailleur Modèle 1924 M29[/i] (or MAC 24/29) is a [[france|French]] [b][[light machine gun]][/b] designed by "Châtellerault Weapons Factory":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manufacture_d%27armes_de_Châtellerault in 1924, and was adopted by the French [[military|Army]] in 1925. Initially chambered for the 7.5×54mm French [[rifle cartridge|cartridge]].
Visually similar to the [[ZB-26]] and [[Bren gun]] with top-loaded [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]], the [[weapon]] features a [[bipod]] that folds on the top of the barrel, a rectangular handguard, and a dual trigger system.

* [[Type 99 light machine gun]]

title: aoi_nabi
body:
[[Virtual Youtuber]] persona of [[Nabi (uz02)|]] debuted on May 2, 2021, her emoji is 🦋 (butterfly - her pen name "Nabi" means butterfly in Korean). Her rigging was done by [[qquack]].

Nabi is a butterfly who from a young age loved Japanese culture and cute characters. She sports a large [[jacket|silver jacket]] that can be taken off to reveal a one piece [[grey sweater|grey sweater]] with a [[open-chest sweater|cleavage cut-out]]. She has [[blue eyes|dark blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long flowing]] [[black hair|black hair]], decorated with various [[hairclip|hair clips]] and a large [[butterfly hair ornament|butterfly]] resting on the left of her head. Behind her ears are also multiple large [[bow earrings|bow earrings]] and on her back she is carrying two oversize [[stylus|stylus pens]].

Speaking in a soft and nervous voice with a surprisingly sharp and upbeat giggle (that sometimes resembles a [[yandere]] laugh); Nabi is an artist skilled at drawing, singing and can speak Korean and Japanese, as well as small amounts of English that she has been studying. She likes cute things, enjoys listening to music and looking at other illustrations. Her favorite food is "Shabu shabu":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shabu-shabu that she claims to try to eat at least once a week. Nabi's favorite color is blue but she dislikes bugs, greasy food and loud noises.

While appeared reserved at first, Nabi would eventually revealed her "wild" sides a month after her debut by hosting a Korean swear word lesson stream and teaching her fans about various vulgar words in Korean. She's also a personal friend of a fellow artist-vtuber [[Ayamy (vtuber)|]] who gets along with her surprisingly well.


She was the main designer for [[Watson Amelia]], [[Amatsuka Uto]], [[Shiratori Rena]], [[Himukai Kogane]], [[Tomo (maesond)|]], as well as the artist for [[Alice Mana]]'s redesign, thus she is known by her fans as "Nabi-mama" and "Nabi-sensei". Nabi's official name for her fans are [b]Nabigators[/b].

title: shulk_(xenoblade)
body:
The main protagonist of [i][[xenoblade chronicles 1|Xenoblade Chronicles]][/i].

A young man who likes to think things through, he is very methodical in his approach to most situations.

Wielder of [[Monado]], the mythical sword of the Bionis.

He reappears in [i][[Xenoblade Chronicles 3: Future Redeemed]][/i], being noticeably older and his right arm replaced with a mechanical one. Interestingly, his new defender role and his arm mishap makes him resemble [[Dunban (xenoblade)|]], his own mentor.
In the context of [i][[Xenoblade Chronicles 3]][/i]'s main game, this hints him as [spoilers]the mentor of Founder Reid of the City.[/spoilers]

title: lettanya
body:
An [[original]] blade dancer [[elf]] woman, who was commissioned by "Mingsplosion":[https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/12522873] who hired many different artists. Lettanya is easily recognizable with [[dark skin]], blue [[body markings]], [[white hair]] in [[twintails]], clad in black cloth with [[gold armor]] accents with orange gemstones, and wielding a [[sword]]. She is often the subject of [[foot focus]], often wearing [[stirrup legwear|stirrups]] over [[barefoot|barefeet]]. When depicted with [[age progression]] her skin gets more tan with age, being pale as a [[child]].

Her backstory indicates that she was a [[slave]] who became a [[gladiator|gladiatrix]].

title: ethan_winters
body:
The faceless protagonist of [[Resident Evil 7: Biohazard]] and [[Resident Evil Village]]. Although he is depicted as a Caucasian man with [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]].

[spoiler]According to [[Eveline]] in a hallucination, Ethan actually died during the events of Dulvey, where [[Jack Baker]] killed him. The mold infection however had revived him.

During the events of Resident Evil Village, Winters had to sacrifice his life to destroy the Megamycete by detonating a remote explosive as the regenerative powers of his mold infection was causing his arm to calcify.[/spoiler]

title: m1917_enfield
body:
The [b]M1917 Enfield[/b] (United States Rifle, cal .30, Model of 1917) is an [[united states|American]] modification and production of the [[P14 Enfield]] [[bolt action]] [b][[rifle]][/b], which was developed and manufactured during 1917–1918. It was used by the U.S. [[military]], mainly during the [[World War I]] and [[World War II]]. Feed system is 6-[[ammunition|round]] internal [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]], loaded with a [[clip (weapon)|clip]].

One distinguishing visual feature from the [[united kingdom|British]] counterpart is a longer and more prominent indentation on the fore-end. 

h1. See also
* [[Lee-Enfield]]
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[M1903 Springfield]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: M1917 Enfield":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M1917_Enfield

title: jacques_de_molay_(foreigner)_(fate)
body:
Foreigner-class Servant introduced in the Halloween 2021 event of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A [[genderswap]]ped version of the 23rd and the last grandmaster of the [[Knights Templar]].

The Foreigner Jacques de Molay is an innocent Heroic Spirit, whose Spirit Origin has been warped and transformed by the scandals and stigma spread by the people in power and the masses who were envious of the Templars. Furthermore, having been possessed by the evil god proclaiming to be the "Holy Mother of the Abyss" that hastens the corruption of mankind, that evil nature has been boosted. Notably turned his body into that of a woman.

It is said that the symbol of the ominous and sinister, "Friday the 13th", comes from the day of the incident when the Templars were simultaneously exposed.

For the original male Saber-class version of Molay, see [[Jacques de Molay (Saber) (fate)]].

Artist: [[Kuroboshi Kouhaku]]

h4.Costumes

* [[jacques de molay (foreigner) (third ascension) (fate)|Third Ascension]]
* [[jacques_de_molay_(dream_portrait)_(fate)|Heroic Spirit Dream Portrait]]

title: olympus_(apex_legends)
body:
An [[in-universe location]] from [[Apex Legends]]. Olympus is the third map, added to the game in Season 7. It is an abandoned floating city on the planet Psamanthe. [[Octane (apex legends)|]], [[Lifeline (apex legends)|]], and [[Horizon (apex legends)|]] are originally from the same planet, while [[Pathfinder (apex legends)|]] was constructed in the city itself.

There are Town Takeovers based on [[Pathfinder (apex legends)|]] and [[Lifeline (apex legends)|]] on the map. 

h4. See also
* "Apex Legends Wiki: Olympus":[https://apexlegends.fandom.com/wiki/Olympus]

title: world_of_guns:_gun_disassembly
body:
A cross-genre simulation and puzzle [[video game]] that allows the player to operate and disassemble various [[weapon]]s, as well as other mechanisms like [[motor vehicle|vehicles]]. It is the latest iteration of "Noble Empire's":http://noble-empire.com/news.php [i]Disassembly[/i] series, first released in 2010 on iOS, expanding on the feature set and library of interactive models.
The software can be used as both an interactive [[gun|firearms]] reference source and encyclopedia, and a casual puzzle game with a goal of disassembling and assembling models in the correct sequence and in the least possible time.


h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: World of Guns: Gun Dissassembly":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_of_Guns:_Gun_Disassembly

title: berthier_rifle
body:
The [b]Berthier [[rifle]]s[/b] and carbines were a family of [[bolt action]] [[gun|small arms]] that came in some variants, used in the [[france|French]] [[military|Army]], and French Colonial Forces, from the 1890s to the beginning of [[World War II]] (1940). It was designed by André Berthier to partially supplant the [[Lebel Model 1886]]. 
Somehow similar to the [[Mosin-Nagant]], the Berthier rifle features a straight grip stock, two handguard bands, and a 3 or 5-[[ammunition|round]] [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]. Some models accept [[Chauchat]] magazines.

h1. See also
* [[Lebel Model 1886]]
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[MAS-36]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Berthier rifle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berthier_rifle

title: mas-38
body:
The [B]MAS-38[/B] ([[french text|French:]] [i]Pistolet Mitrailleur "MAS":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manufacture_d%27armes_de_Saint-Étienne modèle 38[/i]) is an open bolt [b][[submachine gun]][/b] designed in the 1930s and used by [[france|French]] and German [[military|forces]] during [[World War II]]. Chambered for 7.65mm Longue [[ammunition|cartridge]], the weapon features a fixed wooden buttstock and uses 32-round [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]].

title: lebel_model_1886
body:
The [b]Lebel Model 1886[/b] ([[french text|French:]] [i]Fusil Modèle 1886 dit "Fusil Lebel"[/i]) is a [[bolt action]] [b][[rifle]][/b] that entered that entered service in the French [[military|Army]] in 1887, chambered for the 8×50mmR Lebel [[rifle cartridge|cartridge]]. It has a two-piece wood stock and a straight grip buttstock. The rifle's unique feature is a spring-loaded tubular [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] in the fore-end that holds eight [[ammunition|rounds]] in it, one round in the elevator plus one more in the chamber.

h1. See also
* [[Berthier rifle]]
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[MAS-36]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Lebel Model 1886 rifle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebel_Model_1886_rifle
